'''Meditite''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''アサナン''' ''Asanan'') is a dual-type {{2t|Fighting|Psychic}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Medicham}} starting at [[level]] 37.

==Biology==
Meditite is a humanoid, bipedal Pokémon that resembles a person meditating. It usually sits in a yoga position, with knees bent and feet together with its hands resting on its knees. Its lower body is blue, with white on the wrists, feet, and lower body. Its onion-shaped head is also white with large eyes and pink ovals on its cheeks. It has round, swirled ears on the sides of its head. These ears are higher up on a male than on a female.

Meditite heightens its inner energy and spiritual power through the meditation, which allows it to levitate. It trains hours a day, and never skips its daily yoga training. Its training never ends, since it loses concentration and focus while meditating. It eats one berry per day as part of training, which tempers its spirit and makes its senses sharper. It lives and trains on the {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Mountain Pokémon|mountains.}}

==In the anime==
[[File:Maylene Meditite.png|thumb|220px|left|Meditite in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Meditite debuted in ''[[AG030|A Meditite Fight]]'', under the ownership of {{ho|Shauna}}.

In ''[[M09|Pokémon Ranger and the Temple of the Sea]]'', Meditite and its evolved form, {{p|Medicham}}, worked for [[Lizabeth]] and her family. The two Meditation Pokémon used {{m|Psychic}} to make balls of water retain their form.

In ''[[DP066|Lost Leader Strategy!]]'', it was revealed that [[Maylene]] used a Meditite in her Gym battle with [[Paul]], but it was defeated by {{TP|Paul|Honchkrow}}. Her Meditite appeared again in ''[[DP067|Crossing the Battle Line!]]'', where it was used in a battle with {{an|Dawn}}. It battled against her {{TP|Dawn|Buneary}} and won, then it battled against her {{TP|Dawn|Ambipom}}, where it lost. Meditite was then used to battle Ash in ''[[DP068|A Triple Fighting Chance!]]'', where it managed to confuse his {{AP|Chimchar}} and {{AP|Staravia}} before losing to the latter.

===Minor appearances===
A Meditite appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]''.

A Meditite is seen at the beach in ''[[AG162|Spontaneous Combusken!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Maylene Meditite Adventures.png|thumb|100px|Meditite in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Meditite is seen in a flashback being defeated by [[Wallace#Clamperl|Wallace's Clamperl]] during the Pokemon League in ''[[PS251|The Beginning of the End with Kyogre & Groudon XIII]]''.

In ''[[PS356|Magnificent Meditite & Really Riolu I]]'', [[Maylene]] has a Meditite that handily defeated {{adv|Pearl}}'s [[Chatler|Chatot]], who {{adv|Platinum}} borrowed so she could battle her.

A Trainer's Meditite appeared in ''[[PS421|Clobbering Claydol]]''.

==Trivia==
* In {{game|HeartGold and SoulSilver|s}}, Meditite is obtainable via the [[Sinnoh Sound]] even though it was introduced in [[Generation III]]. However, it appears in the [[List of Pokémon by Sinnoh Pokédex number|Sinnoh Pokédex]].
* It is one of the few Pokémon that uses its in-game female sprite for its official artwork.
** However, it was introduced before gender differences.
* Meditite has the lowest base {{stat|HP}} and {{stat|Attack}} of all {{type|Fighting}} Pokémon.

===Origin===
It resembles a {{wp|primate}} of some sort. It appears to have been based on a practitioner of {{wp|yoga}} and is {{wp|meditation|meditating}} in almost all of the media it appears in. Its yoga position in its artwork and sprites is the {{wp|Lotus position|Lotus}}, where one crosses his/her legs and places their feet on the opposing thighs. This position supposedly holds the mind completely steady for long periods of time and calms it, heightening the user's senses. Its hat somewhat resembles a {{wp|turban}} and may also be the caps worn by many depictions of {{wp|Hindu deities}}, such as {{wp|Shiva|Shiva}}, who are commonly seen meditating.

====Name origin====
Meditite may be a combination of the corruptions of ''meditate'' and possibly ''petite'' or ''tyke''. It may also involve a corruption of ''tight'', as in the phrase, "Tight focus."

Asanan may be a corruption of ''{{wp|asana}}'', which in yoga refers to a pose or posture, and 軟 ''nan'' (soft or flexible).
